name: intolerantly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows that you disapprove of or refuse to accept ideas or ways of behaving that are different from your own: She intolerantly thought of grammatical mistakes as unintelligent errors. They accused the critic of writing about the restaurant far more intolerantly than it deserved. See
intolerant
More examplesFewer examplesPeople belonging to other religious communities were treated intolerantly.I call him a bigot because he is intolerantly devoted to his own opinions and prejudice.The landowners acted intolerantly towards the villagers.
